byline.contributor: Julie Hirschfeld Davis reported from Camden, and Michael D. Shear from Washington.
byline.original: By JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

abstract: Pres Obama visits Camden, NJ, to celebrate its revamped police force and to rebut notion that he is insensitive to the plight of police officers on the front lines in American cities where relationship between law enforcement and black communities is tense.
lead_paragraph: Even as President Obama visited Camden to celebrate the progress a revamped police force has made in building trust, there was a sense among some law enforcement officials that he was not on their side.

headline.main: Obama Puts Focus on Police Success in Struggling City in New Jersey
headline.print_headline: Obama Puts Focus on Police Success in Struggling City in New Jersey

snippet: Even as President Obama visited Camden to celebrate the progress a revamped police force has made in building trust, there was a sense among some law enforcement officials that he was not on their side.
